title: For vocalists who have a genuine natural vibrato, where do you physically feel the vibrato and what do you do to initiate it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok I’m a professional singer and have been for many years. I’ve always had vibrato. Even as a kid I had a weirdly dark voice with vibrato. Turns out, I learned in college for music, that a healthy sound has vibrato naturally. You don’t manufacture it. It’s just there. And to answer your question I don’t feel it. If I do, it’s too wide, and it’s a wobble. If it feels to me like straight tone, it has the proper spinny vibrato. To sing actual straight tone is very difficult for me and I’m not sure I can even do it. It takes a lot of effort and weird tension I’m not sure is healthy, so I only use actual straight tone on like a single held note in baroque music or something when I particularly want that sort of whiny sound.

im not a professional singer by any means but i have been singing for a long time..with regards to the vibrato question, its a difficult one to explain..i do not actually physically do anything to initiate it , quite the opposite in fact, i have to actually make a physical effort to stop my vibrato kicking in..my natural vibrato will happen after a few seconds of holding a note unless i stop it , i cant even explain how i stop it, i think the best way of describing it is ; if i relax my throat i have the vibrato but to stop it i have to slightly tense my throat ( muscles ? ).as for actually feeling the vibrato its seems to be just below the adams apple, if that makes sense..
